#sidebar GlueSidebar
==`argcheck(n,v) -> v if v is not nil or error`==
==`argcheck(n,v,type[,default]) -> v if type(v) equals type or error`==
==`argcheck(n,v,true|false[,error,...]) -> v if true or error`==
==`argcheck(n,v,validator[,error,...]) -> validator(v) or error`==
==`argcheck(n,v,options[,default]) -> options[v] or error`==

*Basic type checking of a function argument.<br>*

*Examples*
{{{
argcheck(1,obj) -- arg #1 obj is not nil
argcheck('target',t) -- you can also name arguments if you like
argcheck(1,self,is_banana,'not a banana, mistyped . for : maybe?') -- self is a banana
n = argcheck(1,n,tonumber,'number expected, got %s',type(n)) -- check and convert arg #1 to a number
x = argcheck(1,x,type(x) == 'number' and x == math.floor(x) and x >= 0, 'positive integer expected, got %s', type(x)) -- arg#1 is a natural number
mode = mode ~= nil and argcheck(3,plain,'boolean') or true -- optional arg #3 is a boolean and defaults to true
mode = argcheck(3,plain,'boolean',true) -- same as above
if file then argcheck(2,file,io.type,'file object expected') end -- optional arg #2 is a file
mode = argcheck(4,mode,{r='r',w='w'},'r') --optional arg #4 can be either 'r' or 'w' and defaults to 'r' which is a valid option itself
argcheck(1,f,callable,'callable expected') -- arg #1 is a callable object
argcheck(1) -- arg #1 is invalid
}}}

*See also:* [argerror].
